extendedIngredients.name: mango
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 cup slivered green mango with skin

extendedIngredients.name: swordfish steaks
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds swordfish steaks (1 inch thick), skinned and cut into cubes
extendedIngredients.originalName: swordfish steaks (1 inch thick), skinned and cut into cubes

extendedIngredients.name: thai chile
extendedIngredients.original: 1 serrano or Thai chile, thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: serrano or Thai chile, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: unsweetened dried coconut
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup finely grated dried unsweetened coconut

title: Fish Curry with Green Mango
summary: Fish Curry with Green Mango might be just the main course you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 4 and costs $4.47 per serving. One serving contains 411 calories, 35g of protein, and 25g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have cayenne pepper, swordfish steaks, coconut, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the water you could follow this main course with the Watermelon-Peach Slushies as a dessert. Not a lot of people really liked this Indian dish. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 76%, this dish is pretty good. Try Crispy Curry Fish with Peanut-Mango Slaw, Thai Green Curry Fish, and Grilled Fish With Green Mango Pico De Gallo for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Maysaran Arsheen Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Maysara Arsheen Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A bright expression of fruit right up front, greeting your palate with notes of cut grass on a warm day. The wine is anchored by crisp acidity, but not so much as to overpower a fleeting tease of sweetness that leaves you smiling. Arsheen has a smart, refreshing character that will bestow clarity to a range of preparations of fish, fowl, and pork.

instructions: In a food processor or blender, combine the coconut, onion and 8 of the curry leaves with the coriander, cayenne and turmeric. Add 1/2 cup of the water and process to a paste.                                               In a large deep skillet, combine the coconut paste and salt with the remaining 1/2 cup of water. Add the swordfish in a single layer and bring to a boil. Add the mango, chile and the remaining 8 curry leaves. Gently turn each piece of fish and simmer over low heat until just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

steps.step: In a food processor or blender, combine the coconut, onion and 8 of the curry leaves with the coriander, cayenne and turmeric.
Add 1/2 cup of the water and process to a paste.
In a large deep skillet, combine the coconut paste and salt with the remaining 1/2 cup of water.
Add the swordfish in a single layer and bring to a boil.
Add the mango, chile and the remaining 8 curry leaves. Gently turn each piece of fish and simmer over low heat until just cooked through, about 10 minutes.
